problem_text: (C. C. Edmunds, G. Rosenberger). We call a pair of natural numbers (k, m) admissible if in the derived subgroup F′2 of a free group F2 there is an element w such that the commutator length of the element w^m is equal to k. Find all admissible pairs. It is known that every pair (k, 2), k ⩾ 2, is admissible (V. G. Bardakov, Algebra and Logic, 39 (2000), 224–251). V. G. Bardakov
